intro: Trichospermum ikutae, commonly known as the yellow starling tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Trichospermum ikutae is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
